intro: Dirhamphis mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican dirhamphis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. Dirhamphis mexicana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
